Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the event log For Case C001 Verify Documents appears twice once at the beginning to check identity documents and once after the customer submits additional documents to re-check with the new ID scan Call Customer appears once but in other cases it appears multiple times For Case C002 Call Customer appears twice first to clarify an account discrepancy and second to confirm adjustments made Verify Documents appears once For Case C003 Verify Documents appears twice first for physical verification of ID and second to re-verify after account adjustment Call Customer appears once So the activities that recur within the same case are Verify Documents and Call Customer

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now lets interpret the different meanings based on context 1 Verify Documents In C001 First occurrence is initial verification second is re-verification after receiving additional documents In C002 Only one occurrence identity verification In C003 First is physical verification of ID second is re-verification after account adjustment So the context for Verify Documents can be Initial verification Re-verification after additional docs or adjustments But looking at the additional context C001 first Agent checks identity documents C001 second Agent re-checks documents now that ID scan is provided C002 Identity verification C003 first Physical verification of ID C003 second Re-verify docs after account adjustment

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: So perhaps we can have Initial Document Verification Recheck Documents or Verify Additional Documents But in C003 the second verification is after an account adjustment not necessarily additional documents Maybe better to have Initial Document Verification Post-Adjustment Document Verification But in C001 the second verification is after additional documents are submitted not necessarily after an adjustment Alternatively Initial Document Verification Follow-up Document Verification But that might be too vague Lets look at the specific contexts Alternatively we could include the reason in the name Verify Initial Documents Verify Documents After Additional Submission for C001 Verify Documents After Account Adjustment for C003 This seems more precise

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: 2 Call Customer In C001 to request missing docs In C002 first to clarify account discrepancy second to confirm adjustments In C003 to have customer return after stepping out So the purposes are Request missing informationdocuments Clarify account discrepancy Confirm adjustments Recall customer to branch So possible names Call to Request Missing Documents Call to Clarify Account Discrepancy Call to Confirm Adjustments Call to Recall Customer

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: But looking at the specific contexts in the log C001 Verification incomplete agent calls to request missing docs -> Call to Request Missing Documents C002 first Outbound call to clarify account discrepancy -> Call to Clarify Account Discrepancy C002 second Follow-up call to confirm adjustments made -> Call to Confirm Adjustments C003 Customer stepped out Officer calls to have them return -> Call to Recall Customer to Branch

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now lets go through each case and rename the activities Case C001 1 Initiate Request only once no change needed 2 Verify Documents first -> Verify Initial Documents 3 Call Customer -> Call to Request Missing Documents 4 Submit Additional only once no change needed 5 Verify Documents second -> Verify Documents After Additional Submission 6 Approve Request only once no change needed Case C002 1 Initiate Request no change 2 Verify Documents only once but in context its initial verification -> Verify Initial Documents 3 Call Customer first -> Call to Clarify Account Discrepancy 4 Adjust Account no change only once in this case 5 Call Customer second -> Call to Confirm Adjustments 6 Approve Request no change Case C003 1 Initiate Request no change though the context is walk-in vs online But the activity is Initiate Request in all cases but the context is different online vs branch Should we differentiate The prompt says the same activity names appear multiple times within a single case so across cases might not need renaming unless within a case But Initiate Request only appears once per case so probably no need to rename 2 Verify Documents first -> Verify Initial Documents physical verification of ID 3 Call Customer -> Call to Recall Customer to Branch 4 Adjust Account no change 5 Verify Documents second -> Verify Documents After Account Adjustment 6 Approve Request no change

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Wait the prompt says the same activity names appear multiple times within a single case so we should focus on activities that repeat within the same case Initiate Request only appears once per case so we dont need to rename that Similarly Approve Request only appears once per case Adjust Account appears only once in C002 and C003 so no renaming needed for that So only Verify Documents and Call Customer repeat within cases Let me formalize the renaming For Verify Documents When its the first verification in a case Verify Initial Documents When its a subsequent verification If after additional documents submitted as in C001 Verify Documents After Additional Submission If after account adjustment as in C003 Verify Documents After Account Adjustment But in C002 Verify Documents only appears once so it would be Verify Initial Documents For Call Customer In C001 Call to Request Missing Documents In C002 first Call to Clarify Account Discrepancy In C002 second Call to Confirm Adjustments In C003 Call to Recall Customer to Branch

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now lets apply this to each case Case C001 First Verify Documents Verify Initial Documents Second Verify Documents Verify Documents After Additional Submission Call Customer Call to Request Missing Documents Case C002 Verify Documents Verify Initial Documents only one instance First Call Customer Call to Clarify Account Discrepancy Second Call Customer Call to Confirm Adjustments Case C003 First Verify Documents Verify Initial Documents Second Verify Documents Verify Documents After Account Adjustment Call Customer Call to Recall Customer to Branch

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Now lets write out the revised event log C001 1 Initiate Request 2 Verify Initial Documents 3 Call to Request Missing Documents 4 Submit Additional 5 Verify Documents After Additional Submission 6 Approve Request C002 1 Initiate Request 2 Verify Initial Documents 3 Call to Clarify Account Discrepancy 4 Adjust Account 5 Call to Confirm Adjustments 6 Approve Request C003 1 Initiate Request 2 Verify Initial Documents 3 Call to Recall Customer to Branch 4 Adjust Account 5 Verify Documents After Account Adjustment 6 Approve Request Justification For Verify Documents the first occurrence in each case is the initial verification of documents so named Verify Initial Documents Subsequent verifications are named based on what triggered them additional document submission or account adjustment For Call Customer each instance has a distinct purpose as indicated in the Additional Context column so they are named accordingly to reflect that purpose Now lets format this as a revised event log table
